speaker.name: James Kyle
speaker.bio: I dropped out of high school at 16, made email templates for a marketing internship, then started selling WordPress installs for $50

description: Evolving the web to improve education, accessibility, performance, productivity, and design.
title: Rethinking the Web Platform

speaker.name: Bruce Lawson
speaker.bio: 1981, my Physics teacher made up a UK101 kit in a tiny computer room which I could use instead of Physical Exercise. So I programmed games.

description: We do like our Holy Wars, don't we?: tables vs CSS? Responsive vs mdot? React vs Angular? CSS or CSS-in-JS? Let's look at the real issue: getting the free and open web to the other 4 billion people.
title: If you're going out of San Francisco, be sure to wear Web Standards in your hair

speaker.name: Monica Dinculescu
speaker.bio: I found out my mum always won at the QBasic Gorrilas game bc she changed the other player's code to randomly miss. Then she taught me how.

description: They say there's two things you never want to see made: sausages and web standards. Sooooo I'm going to tell you about both! How do browsers work? What are web components even? Everyone's using them and maybe you should too! üÜíüê±üéâ
title: How the web sausage gets made

speaker.name: Addy Osmani
speaker.bio: At 16, wrote a web browser in C++ to understand how HTML, CSS and JavaScript worked‚Ä¶15 years later, still learning

description: Discover what slows down modern apps on mobile and how to fix this.
title: Lessons learned sciencing the web

speaker.name: Blaine Cook
speaker.bio: A glowing green screen, still fascinating despite its sole output: "SYNTAX ERROR"; Years later, the moment I used ATA and ATDT to talk to a friend.

description: Security is important, but it doesn't have to be complex. Let's dispel myths and assuage fear associated with those linchpin of our online lives ‚Äì passwords ‚Äì and build toward a more secure and more usable web.
title: My Password Doesn't Work!

speaker.name: Katie Fenn
speaker.bio: In 2001 I started making post signatures for a Final Fantasy forum, and then started coding new features for the forum itself.

description: JavaScript does a remarkable job of hiding memory management from us. What's going on behind the scenes?
title: Memory: Don't Forget to Take Out the Garbage

speaker.name: Jenn Schiffer
speaker.bio: my kid laptop had a hangman game written in BASIC and i accessed the source and rigged it to cheat against my half sister!

description: aesthetic is a major component of any medium for art, including the web, but one thing that has been bothering me lately is: what happened to "view source"? are we destroying aesthetic for the sake of tooling and in spite of access to our industry????¬ø¬ø¬ø¬ø
title: Abstract art in a time of minification

speaker.name: Joe Hart
speaker.bio: Parents got me Lego Mindstorms for Xmas, used it and got frustrated that the software didn't let me do exactly what I wanted. Thus here I am

description: A live performance of video games and stand up comedy from comedian and coder, including pre prepared web games to play and even creating a video game with the audience on stage in only 10 minutes.
title: Alpha, Beta, Gamer: Dev Mode
